A: ♣近  chaffer, deal, dicker, haggle, horse-trade, negotiate, equivocate
A: ♣反  candor 坦率

Q:paltry  ['pɔ:ltri]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 无价值的；微不足道的： lacking in importance or worth
A: ♣例  used a paltry, underhanded scheme to get him fired 用一个微小卑鄙的手段炒了他鱿鱼
A: ♣近  inconsequential, inconsiderable, insignificant, niggling, piddling, piffling, trivial
A: ♣反  significant, important, big, consequential, considerable, material 意义重大的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 让人厌恶，让人鄙视的： arousing or deserving of one's loathing and disgust
A: ♣例  a paltry, underhanded scheme to get someone fired 一个卑鄙的炒掉某人的计谋
A: ♣近  cheap, cruddy, deplorable, despicable, grubby, lame, lousy, mean, scummy, scurvy, sneaking, wretched
A: ♣反  admirable, commendable, creditable, laudable, meritorious, praiseworthy 令人尊敬的

Q:pan  [pæn]
A: ♠考法1  v./n. 严厉批评： a harsh criticism
A: ♣例  almost all the movie critics have panned this latest sequel in a tired series 几乎所有的影评家都批评这部最新续集，认为是狗尾续貂
A: ♣近  blame, censure, condemn, denounce, dispraise, reprehend
A: ♣反  eulogize, extol, rave, laud, praise 称赞

Q:panacea  [,pænə'si:ə]
A: ♠考法1  n. 万能药，万灵药： a remedy for all ills or difficulties
A: ♣例  a woman who seems to believe that chicken soup is a panacea for nearly everything 一个相信鸡汤是万能灵药的妇女‖Bicycles are not a panacea for the traffic problem. 自行车并不是解决交通问题的万能药。
A: ♣近  catholicon, cure-all, elixir, nostrum

Q:panache  [pə'næʃ]
A: ♠考法1  n. 炫耀： dash or flamboyance in style and action
A: ♣例  The BBC Symphony Orchestra played with great panache. BBC交响乐队
A: ♣反  humility, unremarkable behavior, dullness 谦逊，寻常举止，平庸乏味

Q:pandemic  [pæn'demik]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 大范围流行的： widespread; general
A: ♣例  pandemic malaria 大规模的疟疾
A: ♣反  limited 有限的

Q:pandemonium  [,pændi'məunjəm]
A: ♠考法1  n. 喧嚣，骚动： wild uproar or noise
A: ♣例  Christmas morning at our house is always marked by pandemonium 圣诞节的早上总是免不了一番吵吵闹闹
A: ♣近  bluster, bustle, disturbance, furor, fuss, hubbub, moil, pother, ruckus, ruction, tumult, turmoil, uproar
A: ♣反  serene 安静

Q:panegyric  [,pæni'dʒirik]
A: ♠考法1  n. 赞颂之词： a eulogistic oration or writing
A: ♣例  wrote a panegyric on the centennial of the Nobel laureate's birth 为诺贝尔获得者百年诞辰纪念日写了一篇溢美之词
A: ♣近  accolade, citation, commendation, dithyramb, eulogium, eulogy, hymn, paean
A: ♣反  anathema, denunciation, condemnation 诅咒，谴责

Q:panoramic  [,pænə'ræmik]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 全景的： of an unobstructed or complete view of an area in every direction
A: ♣例  a panorama of American history 美国历史总览
A: ♣近  compendious, complete, comprehensive, cyclopedic, embracive, exhaustive, thorough, in-depth
A: ♣反  narrow 狭窄的

Q:parable  ['pærəbl]
A: ♠考法1  n. 寓言： a story intended to teach a basic truth or moral about life
A: ♣例  the parable in which the repentant sinner is compared to the returning prodigal son 这个寓言故事将不愿悔过的罪人和回头的浪子进行了比较
A: ♣近  apologue, fable

Q:paradigm  ['pærədim]
A: ♠考法1  n. 典范，模范： one that serves as a pattern or model
A: ♣例  He was the paradigm of the successful man. 他是成功人士的典范
A: ♣近  archetype, example, exemplar, ideal, model, pattern, paragon

Q:paradise  ['pærədais]
A: ♠考法1  n. 天堂，极乐世界： an often imaginary place or state of utter perfection and happiness
A: ♣例  an idealist who trotted the globe looking for paradise 一个奔波于全世界以寻找一片乐土的理想主义者
A: ♣近  bliss, empyrean, heaven, nirvana, utopia
A: ♣反  hell, inferno 地狱
A: ♠考法2  n. 快乐，狂喜： a state of overwhelming usually pleasurable emotion
A: ♣例  that early stage of a romance when lovers are in paradise 爱情初期，当恋人们都处于快乐兴奋的状态时
A: ♣近  elation, euphoria, exhilaration, intoxication, rapture, rhapsody, transport
A: ♣反  dejection, depression, gloominess, melancholy 沮丧，哀伤

Q:paradox  ['pærədɔks]
A: ♠考法1  n. 表面矛盾实际可能正确的话，悖论： a statement that is seemingly contradictory or opposed to common sense and yet is perhaps true
A: ♣例  The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less. 存在的一个悖论就是：如果渔民减少捕鱼量的话，他们将会捕到更多的鱼
A: ♣近  dichotomy, incongruity

Q:paragon  ['pærəɡən]
A: ♠考法1  n. 优秀模范： a model of excellence or perfection of a kind; a peerless example
A: ♣例  a paragon of good husband 模范好丈夫
A: ♣近  archetype, example, exemplar, ideal, model, pattern, paradigm
A: ♠考法2  vt. 把…比作；显示相似： to compare with; parallel
A: ♣例  paragon retreat with treachery 把撤退比作是背叛
A: ♣近  assimilate, compare, equate, liken, match, parallel
A: ♣反  contrast 对比，对照以产生反差

Q:paramount  ['pærəmaunt]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 最重要的： of chief concern or importance
A: ♣例  The paramount goal is to restore the colonial-era house with complete historical accuracy. 最重要的任务就是十分精确地依照历史重建殖民时期的建筑
A: ♣近  cardinal, chief, key, leading, main, predominant, preeminent, primary, principal, supreme
A: ♣反  ancillary, secondary 次要的；paltry, petty, trifling, trivial 不重要的

Q:paranoid  ['pærənɔid]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 多疑的，对他人极端恐惧和怀疑的： exhibiting or characterized by extreme and irrational fear or distrust of others
A: ♣例  a paranoid suspicion that the phone might be bugged 疑神疑鬼地担心电话被窃听了
A: ♣近  distrustful, nervous, suspicious, unbelieving, worried
A: ♣反  credulous 轻信的
A: ♣派  paranoia n. 偏执狂

Q:paraphrase  ['pærəfreiz]
A: ♠考法1  v. 转述，意译，改写： to express something (as a text or statement) in different words
A: ♣例  Could you please paraphrase your diagnosis of my health condition, using simpler language? 您能否用更通俗的话语转述一下您对我健康状况的诊断呢
A: ♣近  rephrase, restate, reword, translate
A: ♣反  quote （不加以修改地）引用

Q:parch  [pɑ:tʃ]
A: ♠考法1  vi. 烤干： to make extremely dry, especially by exposure to heat
A: ♣例  parch a surface from exposure to sun 通过太阳照射烤干一个面
A: ♣近  dehydrate, desiccate, dry, scorch, sear
A: ♣反  douse, drench, hydrate, steep, wash, water, wet 弄湿

Q:parenthesis  [pəˈrenθɪsɪs]
A: ♠考法1  n. 间断： an interruption of continuity; an interval
A: ♣例  a parenthesis in an otherwise solid marriage 在本该是完满婚姻中的一个插曲
A: ♣近  discontinuity, interim, interlude, intermission, interregnum, interruption, interstice, interval
A: ♣反  continuation, continuity 持续不断；resumption 继续

Q:pariah  ['pæriə]
A: ♠考法1  n. 被排斥或鄙视的人： one that is despised or rejected, outcast
A: ♣例  I felt like a pariah when I wore the wrong outfit to the dinner party. 当我穿着不恰当的礼服赴宴时，我感觉自己被别人狠狠地鄙视了
A: ♣近  castaway, castoff, leper, reject
A: ♣反  respectable person 值得尊敬的人

Q:parity  ['pæriti]
A: ♠考法1  n. 相称，同等，平等： the quality or state of being equal or equivalent
A: ♣例  to achieve parity with our commercial competitors 取得与我们的商业竞争对手同等的地位
A: ♣近  coequality, coordinateness, equality, equivalency, par, sameness
A: ♣反  disparity, imparity, inequality 不公平；incommensurateness 不相称

Q:parody  ['pærədi]
A: ♠考法1  n. （以嘲笑原作作者的）模仿作品： a literary or musical work in which the style of an author or work is closely imitated for comic effect or in ridicule
A: ♣例  The Back Dormitory Boys specialize in parody of Backstreet Boys. 后舍男生擅长恶搞后街男孩。
A: ♣近  burlesque, caricature, spoof, travesty
A: ♠考法2  v. 模仿（以嘲弄）： to copy or exaggerate (someone or something) in order to make fun of
A: ♣例  parodying a public figure's mannerisms 模仿嘲弄一个公共人物的举止
A: ♣近  imitate, mock, mimic

Q:paroxysm  ['pærəksizəm]
A: ♠考法1  n. （感情、动作的）突发：a sudden outburst of emotion or action
A: ♣例  a paroxysm of coughing 突然一阵咳嗽
A: ♣近  burst, ebullition, eruption, explosion, flare, flash, flush, gush, outburst, storm
A: ♠考法2  n. （政治、社会领域的）大动荡：a violent disturbance (as of the political or social order)
A: ♣例  Darwin's introduction of the theory of evolution created paroxysms in both religion and science that are still being felt today. 达尔文提出的进化论给宗教界和科学界都带来了巨大的冲击，时至今日我们仍然可以感觉到
A: ♣近  bouleversement, cataclysm, earthquake, hurricane, storm, tempest, tumult, upheaval, uproar

Q:parrot  ['pærət]
A: ♠考法1  vt. （机械地）模仿，复制： to repeat or imitate, especially without understanding
A: ♣例  parrot others blindly 盲目地人云亦云
A: ♣近  copy, ditto, duplicate, echo, quote
A: ♣反  coin, create, devise, invent 创造

Q:parry  ['pæri]
A: ♠考法1  vt. 躲避（问题）： to evade especially by an adroit answer
A: ♣例  He parried the embarrassing question with a clever reply. 他以巧妙的回答躲避了这个令人尴尬的问题
A: ♣近  avoid, dodge, elude, eschew, evade, finesse, scape, shirk, shun
A: ♣反  confront, face, meet 面对；embrace 欣然接受

Q:parsimonious  [,pɑ:si'məunjəs]
A: ♠考法1  n. 过度节俭的，吝啬的： frugal to the point of stinginess
A: ♣例  the stereotype of the dour and parsimonious Scotsman 严肃而吝啬的苏格兰人的典型代表
A: ♣近  closefisted, mean, mingy, miserly, niggardly, penurious, stinting, tight, tightfisted, uncharitable, ungenerous
A: ♣反  generous, liberal, munificent 慷慨的；dissolute, extravagant, prodigal, wasteful 浪费的，挥霍的

Q:partial  ['pɑ:ʃəl]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 偏袒的，偏爱的： inclined to favor one party more than the other: biased
A: ♣例  He is partial to Maverick. 他偏爱小牛队
A: ♣近  biased, one-sided, partisan, prejudiced
A: ♣反  disinterested, equitable, evenhanded, fair, impartial, neutral, objective, unbiased, unprejudiced 公平的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 部分的，不完整的： lacking some necessary part
A: ♣例  a partial answer to the problem 一部分的解答
A: ♣近  deficient, fragmental, fragmentary, half, halfway
A: ♣反  complete, entire, full, intact, integral, perfect, whole 完整的
A: ♣派  partially adv. 部分地；partiality n. 偏袒，偏爱

Q:particularize  [pə'tikjuləraiz]
A: ♠考法1  vt. 详述： to go into or give details or particulars
A: ♣例  particularize the rules you must observe 详述了你需要遵守的规定
A: ♣近  detail, specificate, specify
A: ♣反  abbreviate, abridge, condense, shorten 删减内容

Q:partisan  [,pɑ:ti'zæn]
A: ♠考法1  n. 跟随者，信徒： one who follows the opinions or teachings of another
A: ♣例  Partisans of the charismatic leader refuse to tolerate any criticism of him at all. 跟随者们不允许任何有关他们富有魅力的领导的负面言论
A: ♣近  acolyte, adherent, disciple, pupil, votary
A: ♣反  bellwether, leader 领导者
A: ♠考法2  n. （狂热、坚定的）拥护者，支持者： one who is intensely or excessively devoted to a cause
A: ♣例  a partisan of the revolution who was even willing to give her life for it 一个愿意为了革命献出自己生命的坚定拥护者
A: ♣近  crusader, fanatic, ideologue, zealot, true believer
A: ♣反  adversary, antagonist, opponent 反对者
A: ♠考法3  adj. 偏袒的： inclined to favor one side over another
A: ♣例  a shamelessly partisan news report 一篇无耻的、有倾向性的新闻报道
A: ♣近  biased, one-sided, partial, prejudiced
A: ♣反  disinterested, equitable, evenhanded, fair, impartial, neutral, objective, unbiased, unprejudiced 公平的

Q:partition  [pɑ:'tiʃən]
A: ♠考法1  n. 分割，划分： the act or process of dividing something into parts
A: ♣例  the partition of Czechoslovakia into the Czech Republic and Slovakia 捷克斯洛伐克被分裂成捷克共和国和斯洛伐克
A: ♣近  bifurcation, breakup, cleavage, disunion, division, fractionalization, schism, scission, split, sundering
A: ♣反  unification, union 联合

Q:pastiche  [pæs'ti:ʃ]
A: ♠考法1  n. （带嘲讽的）模仿： a literary, artistic, musical, or architectural work that imitates the style of previous work, often with satirical intent
A: ♣例  a pastiche of Botticelli's Birth of Venus 波提且利画作《维纳斯的诞生》的仿品
A: ♣近  burlesque, caricature, imitation, parody, spoof, travesty
A: ♣反  original work 原作
A: ♠考法2  n. 大杂烩： a pasticcio of incongruous parts; a hodgepodge
A: ♣例  a pastiche of dishes from many countries 来自众多国家的饮食杂烩
A: ♣近  agglomerate, collage, hodgepodge, jumble, jungle, medley, montage, motley, salad, variety, welter

Q:patent  ['pætnt]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 显而易见的，明显的： readily visible or intelligible: obvious
A: ♣例  Unfortunately, the patent flaw of the proposal did not deter the city council from putting it up for a vote. 不幸的是，尽管提案中有着显而易见的缺陷，市议会依然将它拿出来进行投票
A: ♣近  apparent, blatant, conspicuous, evident, flagrant, manifest, obvious, plain
A: ♣反  concealed, hidden, invisible 隐藏的，不可见的

Q:pathological  [,pæθə'lɔdʒikəl]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 不正常的，病态的： being such to a degree that is extreme, excessive, or markedly abnormal
A: ♣例  She has a pathological fear of snakes. 她对蛇有一种病态的恐惧
A: ♣近  abnormal, aberrant, anomalous, morbid
A: ♣反  normal 正常的；natural 自然的

Q:patina  ['pætinə]
A: ♠考法1  n. 外表： a superficial covering or exterior
A: ♣例  a superficial patina of knowledge 表面肤浅的知识
A: ♣近  fa?ade, hull, skin, veneer
A: ♣反  essential quality 本质；core, kernel 核心
A: ♠考法2  n. （由内而外散发的）氛围，气场： an appearance or aura that is derived from association, habit, or established character
A: ♣例  Although the winery is brand-new, it has been constructed and decorated to give it a patina of old-world quaintness. 尽管酿酒厂是全新建造的，但它的构造和装饰都刻意营造出一种古色古香的奇异氛围
A: ♣反  air, ambience, aroma, atmosphere, climate, flavor, halo, odor, smell, temper, vibration

Q:patrician  [pə'triʃən]
A: ♠考法1  n. 贵族，名门望族： a man or woman of high birth or social position
A: ♣例  the rank of a patrician 贵族等级
A: ♣近  aristocrat, noble, blue blood
A: ♣反  plebeian 平民，庶民
A: ♠考法2  adj. 贵族的，地位高的： of high birth, rank, or station
A: ♣例  came from a patrician family 出身贵族世家
A: ♣近  aristocratic, genteel, gentle, grand, great, highborn, highbred, upper-class, wellborn
A: ♣反  baseborn, common, humble, ignoble, low, lower-class, mean 地位低下的

Q:patriot  ['peitriət]
A: ♠考法1  n. 爱国者： one who loves his or her country and supports its authority and interests
A: ♣例  The USA PATRIOT Act has generated a great deal of controversy since its enactment. 自实施之日起，美国的《爱国者法案》就产生了大量的争议‖a fanatical patriot 狂热的爱国者
A: ♣近  loyalist, nationalist, partisan
A: ♣反  apostate, recreant, renegade, traitor, turncoat 叛徒；insurgent, mutineer, rebel 叛乱者
A: ♣派  patriotism n. 爱国主义

Q:patronize  ['pætrənaiz]

A: ♣例  a company that loyally patronizes the arts 一个一直以来坚持赞助艺术界的公司
A: ♣近  advocate, back, champion, endorse, support, uphold
A: ♣反  baffle, foil, frustrate, sabotage 阻挠，从中破坏
A: ♠考法2 v. 以高人一等的态度对待：to adopt an air of condescension toward : treat haughtily or coolly
A: ♣例  a director with an unpleasant habit of patronizing even his most gifted actors 一个有着令人讨厌习惯的导演，他即便是对手下最有才华的演员也傲慢地对待
A: ♣近  condescend
A: ♣派  patron n. 赞助人

Q:paucity  ['pɔ:siti]

A: ♣反  abundance, adequacy, amplitude, opulence, plenitude, sufficiency, wealth 大量，丰富

Q:paunchy  ['pɔ:ntʃi]

A: ♣近  corpulent, fat, potbellied
A: ♣反  slender, slim, svelte, thin 瘦的，苗条的

Q:peck  [pek]
A: ♠考法1  n. 大量： a considerable amount
A: ♣例  Now you're in a peck of trouble. 现在你有一堆麻烦了
A: ♣近  abundance, bunch, bundle, dozen, mass, mountain, much, multiplicity, myriad, pile, plenitude, profusion, ton, volume, wealth
A: ♣反  bit, glimmer, handful, hint, little, mite, nip, ounce, peanuts, pittance, spot, sprinkle, trace 少量
A: ♠考法2  v. （不情愿地）小口咬： to eat reluctantly and in small bites
A: ♣例  Fashion models never really eat: they just peck at small meals in expensive restaurants. 时装模特们几乎不吃东西——他们只是随便咬一口昂贵餐厅里的食物
A: ♣近  bite, nibble, sip, tipple
A: ♣近  devour, gobble, gorge, guzzle, quaff, swill 贪婪地吃喝，大口吃喝

Q:peculiarity  [pi,kju:li'æriti]

A: ♣例  It is a peculiarity of the house that there is no front door. 没有大门是这座房子的一个特色。
A: ♣近  attribute, character, criterion, diagnostic, differentia, feature, fingerprint, hallmark, mark, note, particularity, quality, specific, trait

Q:pedagogical  [pedə'gɔdʒikəl]

A: ♣近  preceptorial

A: ♣反  disciple, pupil, student 弟子，学生

Q:pedant  ['pedənt]

A: ♣例  He is a perfect type of pedant. 他是个十足的书呆子
A: ♣近  doctrinaire, dogmatist

Q:pedestrian  [pi'destriən]

A: ♣近  footer, walker
A: ♣反  rider 骑手
A: ♠考法2  adj. 平庸无奇的，令人厌倦的： causing weariness, restlessness, or lack of interest
A: ♣例  His style is so pedestrian that the book becomes a real bore. 他的风格是如此平庸以至于整本书显得非常无聊
A: ♣近  arid, dreary, dull, flat, jading, jejune, monochromatic, monotonous, stale, stodgy, tedious, wearisome
A: ♣反  absorbing, engaging, engrossing, gripping, interesting, intriguing, involving, riveting 吸引人的

Q:peel  [pi:l]

A: ♣例  peeled off the wet clothes 脱去湿衣服
A: ♣近  doff, douse, put off, shrug off, take off
A: ♣反  don, put on 穿上

Q:peep  [pi:p]

A: ♣例  take a peep at the new neighbors偷偷瞄了我们的新邻居一眼
A: ♣近  gander, glance, glimpse, peek
A: ♠考法2  n. 轻声： a slight sound or utterance
A: ♣例  I haven't heard a peep out of the children for an hour.我已经一个小时没听到孩子们的声音了
A: ♣近  mumble, murmur, mutter, twitter, whisper
A: ♣反  clamor, noise, outcry, roar 喧哗，吵闹

Q:peer  [piə]
A: ♠考法1  n. 同等地位的人，同辈： a person who has equal standing with others
A: ♣例  stand out among peers 在同辈当中很出众
A: ♣近  coequal, compeer, coordinate, counterpart, equivalent, fellow, match, parallel
A: ♣反  inferior 地位更低的人；superior 地位更高的人
A: ♠考法2  v. 好奇地凝视： to look narrowly or curiously;
A: ♣例  peer at the variety of marine life in the aquarium's huge tank 好奇地注视着巨大水族箱中丰富多样的海洋生物
A: ♣近  blink, gape, gawk, gaze, goggle, rubberneck, stare
A: ♣反  glance, glimpse 投去一瞥
A: ♣派  peerless adj. 无与伦比的，不可比拟的

Q:peeve  [pi:v]
A: ♠考法1  vt. 打扰，惹恼： to disturb the peace of mind of (someone) especially by repeated disagreeable acts
A: ♣例  be constantly peeved by his affected flattery 总是被他做作的谄媚所惹恼
A: ♣近  aggravate, annoy, bother, exasperate, frost, gall, irk, nettle, pique, rile, ruffle, vex
A: ♣反  becalm, compose, lull, lullaby, quiet, salve, settle, soothe, still, tranquilize 使镇定
A: ♣派  peevish adj. 易怒的，脾气不好的

Q:pejorative  ['pi:dʒərətive]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 轻蔑的，贬低的： disparaging; belittling
A: ♣例  I agree that I am ambitious, and I don't see it as a pejorative term. 我承认我“雄心勃勃”，但我并不认为这是一个贬义词
A: ♣近  belittling, contemptuous, degrading, deprecatory, depreciative, derogative, disdainful, disparaging, scornful
A: ♣反  commendatory, complimentary, laudatory 赞美的

Q:pellucid  [pe'lju:sid]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 透明的： admitting the passage of light
A: ♣例  pellucid spring water 清澈透明的泉水
A: ♣近  crystal, crystalline, limpid, liquid, lucent, transparent
A: ♣反  opaque 不透明的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 清晰明确的，易懂的： transparently clear in style or meaning
A: ♣例  Her poetry has a pellucid simplicity that betrays none of the sweat that went into writing it. 她的诗歌风格十分清新简约，丝毫没有体现出她为此付出的汗水
A: ♣近  apparent, distinct, evident, lucid, manifest, obvious, palpable, patent, perspicuous, plain, straightforward
A: ♣反  clouded, cryptic, enigmatic, indistinct, mysterious, obfuscated, obscure 模糊难懂的

Q:pen  [pen]
A: ♠考法1  n. 监狱： a place of confinement for persons held in lawful custody
A: ♣例  spent six years in a federal pen 在联邦监狱中度过了六年
A: ♣近  bastille, coop, jail, prison, stockade
A: ♠考法2  v. 关押，监禁： to close or shut in by or as if by barriers
A: ♣例  remember to pen up the dogs when visitors come over 客人来的时候别忘了把狗给关起来
A: ♣近  box, encage, encase, envelop, fence, hedge, immure, include, wall
A: ♣反  release 释放；enfranchise, free, liberate, set free 使自由

Q:penalty  ['penəlti]
A: ♠考法1  n. （对罪行的）处罚： a punishment established by law or authority for a crime or offense
A: ♣例  The maximum penalty is 7 years’ imprisonment. 最为严厉的惩罚是七年的有期徒刑
A: ♣近  fine, forfeit, punishment, retribution
A: ♣反  honor, reward 奖励
A: ♣派  penalize v. 处以惩罚

Q:penchant  ['pentʃənt]
A: ♠考法1  n. 强烈嗜好，迷恋： a strong and continued inclination
A: ♣例  a penchant for Champaign 非常喜爱香槟
A: ♣近  affection, bias, disposition, leaning, partiality, predilection, predisposition, proclivity, propensity, tendency
A: ♣反  aversion, disfavor, disinclination, dislike, distaste, loathing, repugnance, repulsion 反感

Q:penitent  ['penitənt]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 悔过的： feeling or expressing humble or regretful pain or sorrow for sins or offenses
A: ♣例  a penitentbusinessman who had come to ask for forgiveness 一个来寻求宽恕的决定悔过自新的商人
A: ♣近  apologetic, compunctious, regretful, remorseful, repentant, rueful, sorry
A: ♣反  impenitent, remorseless, unapologetic, unrepentant 不知悔改的

Q:pensive  ['pensiv]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 沉思的，（尤指）哀思的： given to or marked by long, quiet and often musingly sadthinking
A: ♣例  Rainy days often put her in a pensive mood. 雨天总是让她陷入深深的思考之中
A: ♣近  broody, cogitative, meditative, melancholy, musing, reflective, ruminant, ruminative, thoughtful
A: ♣反  mindless, thoughtless, unreflective 不加思考的

Q:penury  ['penjuri]
A: ♠考法1  n. 贫穷： extreme dearth; barrenness or insufficiency
A: ♣例  Some have pessimistically regarded the higher education in China as an invisible and irresistible path to penury. 有人悲观地把中国的高等教育看作是一条通往贫穷的通道——无形但不可抗拒
A: ♣近  destitution, impecuniosity, impoverishment, indigence, neediness, poorness, poverty, want
A: ♣反  affluence, opulence, richness, wealth 富裕
A: ♠考法2  n. 吝啬，节俭： extreme and often niggardly frugality
A: ♣例  They bitterly complained about their father's penury. 他们哀怨地抱怨父亲的节俭
A: ♣近  closeness, miserliness, niggardliness, parsimony, penuriousness, stinginess, tightfistedness, tightness
A: ♣反  generosity, largesse, munificence, openhandedness, philanthropy 慷慨的
A: ♣派  penurious adj. 贫穷的；吝啬的

Q:perambulate  [pə'ræmbjuleit]
A: ♠考法1  v. 徒步穿越，走过： to travel over or through especially on foot for exercise or pleasure
A: ♣例  We decided to lazily perambulate the entire length of the esplanade and enjoy the fresh air. 我们决定悠哉地徒步走过滨海大道，享受清新的空气
A: ♣近  amble, cross, go, navigate, pass, peregrinate, proceed, ramble, transit, travel, traverse

Q:perceptible  [pə'septibl]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 可察觉的： capable of being perceived especially by the senses
A: ♣例  You should be able to note a perceptible temperature change when you add the second reagents. 当你加入第二种试剂的时候，你应该能够察觉到明显的温度变化
A: ♣近  appreciable, apprehensible, detectable, discernible, distinguishable, palpable, sensible
A: ♣反  impalpable, imperceptible, inappreciable, indistinguishable, insensible, undetectable 不能感知的

Q:perceptive  [pə'septiv]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 敏锐的： able to sense slight impressions or differences
A: ♣例  Due to their ability to rotate their ears, cats are very perceptive when it comes to pinpointing the source of a sound. 由于猫能够转动它们的耳朵，所以它们能十分敏锐地确定声源的位置。
A: ♣近  delicate, fine, keen,quick, sensitive, sharp
A: ♣反  dead, imperceptive, insensible, insensitive, numb 反应慢的，麻木的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 洞察力强的： having or showing deep understanding and intelligent application of knowledge
A: ♣例  A perceptive teacher was able to discover what was really troubling the youth. 一个洞察力强的老师应该能察觉真正困扰青少年是什么。
A: ♣近  discerning, insightful, prudent, sagacious, sage, sapient
A: ♣反  brainless, dumb, foolish, idiotic, imbecile, moronic, silly, simple, slow, stupid, thoughtless, unintelligent, unwise, witless 愚钝的

Q:peremptory  [pə'remptəri]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 不容反抗的： not allowing contradiction or refusal; imperative
A: ♣例  a peremptory order from the general 将军下达的不容反抗的命令
A: ♣近  compulsory, forced, imperative, incumbent, involuntary, obligatory, required
A: ♣反  elective, optional, voluntary 可选择的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 爱发号施令的： fond of ordering people around
A: ♣例  The peremptory secretary began telling the crowd of reporters and photographers exactly where they had to stand. 爱发号施令的秘书开始部署记者和摄影师们应该站在哪里了
A: ♣近  authoritarian, despotic, dictatorial, domineering, imperious, masterful, overbearing, tyrannical, tyrannous
A: ♠考法3  adj. 傲慢的： having a feeling of superiority that shows itself in an overbearing attitude
A: ♣例  She had such a peremptory approach to running the club that people started to avoid her. 她用一种如此傲慢自大的方式来管理俱乐部，以至于大家纷纷开始躲避她
A: ♣近  assumptive, bumptious, haughty, imperious, lofty, pompous, presumptuous, pretentious, supercilious
A: ♣反  humble, lowly, modest 谦逊的

Q:perfervid  [pə:'fə:vid]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 非常热情的： marked by overwrought or exaggerated emotion: excessively fervent
A: ♣例  perfervid love letter 热情洋溢的情书
A: ♣近  ardent, demonstrative, emotional, fervid, feverish, impassioned, passionate, torrid, vehement, warm
A: ♣反  cold, cool, detached, dispassionate, emotionless, impassive, unemotional 冷漠的

Q:perfidy  ['pə:fidi]
A: ♠考法1  n. 不忠，背信弃义： an act or an instance of disloyalty
A: ♣例  As loyalty unites lovers, so perfidy estranges friends. 忠诚是爱情的纽带，欺诈是友谊的敌人
A: ♣近  backstabbing, disloyalty, infidelity, sellout, treachery, unfaithfulness, double cross
A: ♣反  allegiance, devotion, faithfulness, fidelity, loyalty, staunchness, steadfastness 忠诚
A: ♣派  perfidious adj. 不忠诚的

Q:perforate  ['pə:fəreit]
A: ♠考法1  v. 打孔，穿透： to make a hole through
A: ♣例  to perforate with a pin 用针穿孔
A: ♣近  bore, drill, hole, pierce, punch, puncture, riddle

Q:perfunctory  [pə'fʌŋktəri]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 例行公事的，敷衍的： characterized by routine or superficiality and often done merely as a duty
A: ♣例  gave his usual perfunctory nod 例行公事地随便点了个头
A: ♣近  automatic, cursory, mechanical, superficial
A: ♠考法2  adj. 不感兴趣的： lacking in interest or enthusiasm
A: ♣例  She gave the list only a perfunctory glance. 她无所谓地随便瞅了名单一眼
A: ♣近  apathetic, casual, disinterested, incurious, indifferent, insouciant, nonchalant, pococurante, unconcerned
A: ♣反  concerned, interested 感兴趣的

Q:perilous  ['periləs]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 危险的： involving potential loss or injury
A: ♣例  perilous journey through hostile territory 穿过敌方领土的危险行程
A: ♣近  dangerous, grave, grievous, hazardous, jeopardizing, menacing, risky, serious, threatening, venturesome
A: ♣反  harmless, innocent, innocuous, safe, unthreatening 安全的，无害的

Q:perimeter  [pə'rimitə]
A: ♠考法1  n. 边界，界限： the line or relatively narrow space that marks the outer limit of something
A: ♣派  soldiers guarding the perimeter of the camp 守卫者营地边界的士兵
A: ♣近  borderline, bound, boundary, circumference, confines, edge, frame, fringe, margin, periphery, skirt, verge
A: ♣反  center, core, heart, kernel 核心

Q:periodical  [,piəri'ɔdikəl]
A: ♠考法1  n. 期刊： a publication that appears at regular intervals
A: ♣派  subscribed to three new periodicals 订阅了三份新的期刊
A: ♣近  book, magazine, newspaper, paper, review, serial
A: ♠考法2  adj. 周期性的，有固定间隔的： occurring or recurring at regular intervals
A: ♣派  periodical announcements from airline personnel concerning the delay 航空公司工作人员关于延误所进行的一遍又一遍的广播
A: ♣近  continual, periodic, recurrent, recurring
A: ♣反  constant, continuous, incessant, unceasing 持续不断的

Q:peripatetic  [,peripə'tetik]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 巡游的，四处游历的： walking about or from place to place
A: ♣派  peripatetic preachers四处游历的传教士
A: ♣近  ambulant, errant, nomadic, perambulatory, peregrine, vagabond, wandering
A: ♣反  sedentary, settled 定居的

Q:peripheral  [pə'rifərəl]
A: ♠考法1 adj. 外围的： related to, located in, or constituting an outer boundary or periphery
A: ♣例  development in the peripheral areas of megacities 大城市边缘地区的发展
A: ♣近  circumferential, marginal
A: ♣反  central 中心的；interior 内部的
A: ♠考法2 adj. 辅助性的： available to supply something extra when needed
A: ♣例  The IT consultant suggested that we update the drivers for all of the computer's peripheral devices. IT咨询师建议我们更新电脑所有外围辅助设备的驱动程序
A: ♣近  accessorial, accessory, appurtenant, supplemental, supplementary
A: ♣反  chief, main, principal 主要的

Q:perish  ['periʃ]
A: ♠考法1  vi. 死亡，消亡： to become destroyed or ruined: cease to exist
A: ♣例  thrive in calamity and perish in soft living 生于忧患，死于安乐‖adapt or perish 适应或是消亡
A: ♣近  decease, demise, die, end, expire, succumb, pass away
A: ♣反  breathe, live, survive 活着，存活

Q:permanent  ['pə:mənənt]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 永恒的： continuing or enduring without fundamental or marked change; lasting forever
A: ♣例  A temporary compromise has been accepted until a more permanent solution can be agreed upon. 在更为持久的决案被通过之前，一个暂时性的妥协方案被接受了
A: ♣近  ceaseless, dateless, deathless, endless, eternal, immortal, perpetual, undying, unending
A: ♣反  ephemeral, evanescent, transient, transitory 稍瞬即逝的；provisional, temporary 暂时性的
A: ♣派  permanence n. 永恒

Q:permeable  ['pə:miəbl]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 可渗透的： capable of being permeated or penetrated, especially by liquids or gases
A: ♣例  a permeable fabric that allows your body heat to escape 一种能使身体热量耗散的透气纤维
A: ♣近  passable, penetrable, pervious, porous
A: ♣反  waterproof 防水的；impassable, impenetrable, impervious, impermeable 不能渗透的

Q:pernicious  [pə'niʃəs]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 有害的： highly injurious or destructive
A: ♣例  Business may be troublesome but idleness is pernicious. 工作烦人，懒散害人
A: ♣近  adverse, baleful, damaging, deleterious, detrimental, hurtful, injurious, mischievous, nocuous, noxious
A: ♣反  anodyne, benign, harmless, innocent, innocuous, inoffensive, safe 温和的，无害的

Q:peroration  [,perə'reiʃən]
A: ♠考法1  n. （演讲的）结束语： the concluding part of a discourse and especially an oration
A: ♣例  He summarized his main points in his peroration. 他在结束语中总结了自己的主要观点
A: ♣近  coda, conclusion, denouement, epilogue, finale
A: ♣反  foreword, prelude, preface, prologue, overture 前言，序曲
A: ♠考法2  n.（正式的）演讲，致辞： a usually formal discourse delivered to an audience
A: ♣例  a peroration celebrating the nation's long tradition of religious tolerance and pluralism 为庆祝该国长期以来对于宗教的容忍态度和宗教多元化所做的一个演讲
A: ♣近  address, declamation, harangue, oration, speech, talk

Q:perpetual  [pə'petʃuəl]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 永恒的，不断的： continuing forever：everlasting
A: ♣例  perpetual motion machine 永动机
A: ♣近  ceaseless, dateless, deathless, endless, eternal, immortal, perpetual, undying, unending
A: ♣反  ephemeral, evanescent, transient, transitory 稍瞬即逝的；provisional, temporary 暂时性的
A: ♣派  perpetuate v. 使永恒

Q:perquisite  ['pə:kwizit]
A: ♠考法1  n. 额外的好处： something given in addition to what is ordinarily expected or owed
A: ♣例  give the movers a perquisite if they do a good job 如果搬家工人做得好就会获得一定的小费‖The use of a company car is one perquisite of the job. 能使用公司的汽车是这项工作的附加好处之一。
A: ♣近  cumshaw, dividend, donative, extra, gratuity, gravy, lagniappe, perk, tip

Q:persecute  ['pə:sikju:t]
A: ♠考法1  vt. 迫害，折磨： to cause persistent suffering to
A: ♣例  people who were persecuted simply for practicing their religious faith 因为实践宗教信仰而惨遭迫害的人
A: ♣近  agonize, anguish, curse, excruciate, harrow, plague, rack, torment, torture
A: ♣派  persecution n. 迫害

Q:persevere  [,pə:si'viə]
A: ♠考法1  vi. 坚持不懈，不屈不挠： to persist in or remain constant to a purpose, idea, or task in the face of obstacles or discouragement
A: ♣例  Although he was frustrated by the lack of financial resources and support, hepersevered in his scientific research. 尽管因为资金不足而受阻，但他仍坚持进行科学研究
A: ♣近  carry on, endure, persist
A: ♣反  renounce, succumb, surrender, yield放弃，屈服
A: ♣派  perseverance n. 坚持不懈

Q:persiflage  ['pə:siflɑ:ʒ]
A: ♠考法1  n. 打趣： good-natured teasing or exchanging of clever remarks
A: ♣例  Their tongue-in-cheek persiflage is sometimes mistaken for an exchange of insults by people who don't know them. 他们半开玩笑的打趣有时候被不认识他们的人误认为是在互相对骂
A: ♣近  backchat, badinage, chaff, jesting, joshing, raillery, repartee

Q:persistence  [pə'sistəns]
A: ♠考法1  n. 坚持，持续： uninterrupted or lasting existence
A: ♣近  The persistenceof the fever for a week caused me great worry. 持续一周的发烧让我很不安
A: ♣近  ceaselessness, continuance, continuity, durability, endurance, subsistence
A: ♣反  cessation, close, end, expiration, finish, stoppage, surcease, termination 停止
A: ♣派  persistent adj. 持续不断的

Q:personable  ['pə:sənəble]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 风度翩翩的，吸引人的： pleasing in personality or appearance; attractive
A: ♣例  apparently be attracted by a personable young man 明显被一位风度翩翩的少年迷住了
A: ♣近  alluring, appealing, attractive, captivating, charismatic, charming, comely, enchanting, handsome, pretty
A: ♣反  grotesque, hideous, ugly 丑陋的；homely 相貌平庸的

Q:perspicacious  [,pə:spi'keiʃəs]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 极敏锐的，有洞察力的： having or showing penetrating mental discernment; clear-sighted
A: ♣例  an impartial and perspicacious judge一个明镜高悬的法官
A: ♣近  astute, savvy, sharp, sharp-witted, shrewd, smart
A: ♣反  ignorant, oblivious, unknowing 未察觉的，无知的
A: ♣派  perspicacity n. 敏锐，洞察力

Q:perspicuity  [,pə:spi'kju:əti]
A: ♠考法1  n. 清晰明了： the quality of being perspicuous; clearness and lucidity
A: ♣例  The key of modern enterprise system is the prespicuity of property right. 现代企业制度的核心是产权的明晰
A: ♣近  clarity, clearness, explicitness, lucidity, lucidness, perspicuousness
A: ♣反  obscureness, obscurity, unclarity 模糊不清；ambiguity 模棱两可

Q:pertain  [pə:'tein]
A: ♠考法1  v. 有关联： to have a relation or connection; relate
A: ♣例  new evidence that pertains to the accident 与事故相关的新证据
A: ♣近  appertain, bear, concern, refer, relate
A: ♣派  pertaining adj. 有关系的

Q:pertinacious  [,pə:ti'neiʃəs]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 顽固的，固执地坚持的： sticking to an opinion, purpose, or course of action in spite of reason, arguments, or persuasion
A: ♣例  The pertinacious boy won’t stop crying unless his desire is satisfied. 这个固执的男孩在愿望没有满足的情况下是不会停止哭泣的
A: ♣近  adamant, headstrong, implacable, inflexible, intransigent, mulish, obdurate, perverse, stubborn, willful
A: ♣反  compliant, flexible, pliable, pliant, yielding 容易受影响的，容易控制的

Q:pertinent  ['pə:tinənt]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 相关的，恰当的： having a clear decisive relevance to the matter in hand
A: ♣例  He impressed the jury with his concise, pertinent answers to the attorney's questions. 他对律师提出的问题的简洁而恰当的回答给陪审团留下了深刻的印象
A: ♣近  applicable, apposite, apropos, germane, material, pointed, relative, relevant
A: ♣反  extraneous, immaterial, impertinent, inapplicable, inapposite, irrelevant, pointless 无关的
A: ♣派  pertinence n. 相关，恰当

Q:perturb  [pə'tə:b]
A: ♠考法1  vt. 扰乱，使烦躁不安： to trouble the mind of; to make uneasy
A: ♣例  perturbed me enough to keep me awake that night 让我烦躁到当晚失眠
A: ♣近  agitate, ail, bother, discomfort, discompose, distress, unsettle, upset
A: ♣反  calm, compose, quiet, settle, soothe, tranquilize使镇定
A: ♣派  perturbation n. 打扰，扰乱

Q:peruse  [pə'ru:z]
A: ♠考法1  v. 细读： to read or examine, typically with great care
A: ♣例  perused the manuscript to check for grammatical errors 细读手稿以检查语法错误
A: ♣近  examine, scrutinize
A: ♣反  glance, glimpse, scan, skim 一瞥，迅速浏览

Q:pervade  [pə:'veid]
A: ♠考法1  vt. 弥漫，充满： to be present throughout; permeate
A: ♣例  The mixed smell of sawdust and glue pervaded the whole factory. 锯末与胶水的味道弥漫了整个工厂‖the corruption that pervades every stratum of society 充斥在社会每个阶层中的腐败
A: ♣近  interpenetrate, percolate, riddle, suffuse, transfuse
A: ♣派  pervasive adj.弥漫的

Q:pessimistic  [,pesi'mistik]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 悲观的： tending to stress the negative or unfavorable or to take the gloomiest possible view
A: ♣例  With that pessimistic attitude, it's no wonder you're depressed. 你的人生观如此悲观，难怪你会感到压抑
A: ♣近  bearish, defeatist, despairing, downbeat, hopeless
A: ♣反  optimistic 乐观的
A: ♣派  pessimism n. 悲观主义

Q:petition  [pi'tiʃən]
A: ♠考法1  n. 请愿，正式的申请： a solemn supplication or request to a superior authority; an entreaty
A: ♣例  a petition for divorce 离婚申请书
A: ♣近  appeal, cry, entreaty, pleading, solicitation, supplication
A: ♠考法2  v. （尤指正式地）请求： to make a request, especially a formal written one
A: ♣例  She is petitioning to regain custody of the child. 为了重新获得孩子的监护权，她提出了正式申请
A: ♣近  adjure, beseech, conjure, entreat, impetrate, implore, importune, plead, solicit, supplicate
A: ♣派  petitioner n. 申请人，请愿者

Q:petrify  ['petrifai]
A: ♠考法1  v. 使僵化，失去活力： to cause to become stiff or stone-like; deaden
A: ♣例  Pressure from family has petrified his once innovative mind. 家庭的压力使他的头脑失去了往日的创造力
A: ♣近  damp, dampen, deaden, devitalize, enervate, lobotomize, ossify
A: ♣反  brace, energize, enliven, invigorate, quicken, stimulate, vitalize, vivify 使有活力
A: ♣派  petrification n. 石化，僵化

Q:petty  ['peti]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 细微的，不重要的： of small importance; trivial
A: ♣例  play petty tricks 耍小聪明
A: ♣近  inconsequential, inconsiderable, insignificant, measly, minute, paltry, peanut, slight, trifling, trivial
A: ♣反  consequential, considerable, important, material, momentous, significant 重大的，重要的

Q:petulant  ['petjulənt]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 易怒的，爱发脾气的： easily irritated or annoyed
A: ♣例  He is a petulant and fussy man who is always blaming everyone else for his problems. 他是一个对细节非常在意而又容易生气的人，还总是把自己的问题怪罪到别人的头上。
A: ♣近  choleric, grouchy, grumpy, irascible, irritable, peevish, perverse, pettish, prickly, raspy, ratty, stuffy, testy
A: ♣反  forbearing, obliging, patient, stoic , tolerant 容忍的，忍让的
A: ♣派  petulance n. 易怒，坏脾气

Q:phenomenal  [fi'nɔminəl]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 不寻常的，非凡的： being out of the ordinary;extraordinary; outstanding
A: ♣例  the phenomenal growth that the suburb has experienced over the last decade 过去几十年间郊区所经历的令人称奇的快速发展
A: ♣近  especial, exceptional, extraordinary, peculiar, preternatural, rare, singular, uncommon, unusual
A: ♣反  common, normal, ordinary, typical 普通的，典型的

Q:philanthropic  [,filən'θrɔpik]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 博爱的，为他人着想的： having or showing a concern for the welfare of others
A: ♣例  the philanthropic aims of the organization 这个机构的博爱、利他的目标
A: ♣近  altruistic, beneficent, benevolent, eleemosynary, good, humanitarian
A: ♣反  misanthropic 反人类的；selfish 自私的
A: ♣派  philanthropist n. 博爱的人

Q:philistine  ['filistain]
A: ♠考法1  n. 市侩（注重物质而鄙视智慧或艺术的人）： a person who is guided by materialism and is usually disdainful of intellectual or artistic values
A: ♣例  The philistine's critics sometime limit artists’ imagine. 市侩之人的批评有时会限制艺术家的想象力
A: ♣近  lowbrow, materialist
A: ♣反  highbrow 文化修养高的人

Q:phlegmatic  [fleɡ'mætik]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 冷静的，无感情的，淡漠的： having or suggesting a calm, sluggish temperament; unemotional
A: ♣例  a strangely phlegmatic response to what should have been happy news 对本该是一个让人开心的新闻的冷漠回复
A: ♣近  affectless, apathetic, cold-blooded, emotionless, impassible, numb, stoic, stolid
A: ♣反  demonstrative, emotional, fervent, fervid, impassioned, passionate, vehement 感情丰富的，热情的

Q:piddling  ['pidliŋ]

A: ♣例  raised a piddling objection to the plan 对计划提出了一个微不足道的反对
A: ♣近  inconsequential, inconsiderable, insignificant, measly, minute, paltry, peanut, slight, trifling, trivial
A: ♣反  consequential, considerable, important, material, momentous, significant 重大的，重要的

Q:piebald  ['paibɔ:ld]

A: ♣近  blotched, dappled, marbled, mottled, splotched, spotted
A: ♣反  monochromatic 单色的

A: ♣近  assorted, eclectic, heterogeneous, hybrid, magpie, mixed, motley, promiscuous, varied
A: ♣反  homogeneous 由相同类型事物组成的

Q:pigment  ['piɡmənt]

A: ♣近  paint, stain, tincture, tinge, tint
A: ♣反  blanch 漂白；decolorize 脱色

Q:pillar  ['pilə]

A: ♣近  column, pier, pilaster
A: ♠考法2  n. （物质、精神等方面的）支柱： something or someone to which one looks for support

A: ♣近  anchor, buttress, mainstay, reliance, standby

Q:pillory  ['piləri]

A: ♣例  The candidate mercilessly pilloried his opponent. 候选人在大众面前无情地羞辱他的对手。‖He resigned after being pilloried by the press. 在遭到媒体嘲弄之后他愤然辞职。
A: ♣近  abase, debase, degrade, denounce, humiliate, ridicule
A: ♣反  carol, eulogize, exalt, extol, laud 赞美

Q:pilot  ['pailət]

A: ♣近  aviator, bellwether, captain, guide, helmsman, leader, navigator
A: ♠考法2  adj. 初步的，试验性的： serving as a tentative model for future experiment or development
A: ♣例  They carried out a pilot study before the larger, more expensive project was started 在更大规模、更为昂贵的项目开始之前，他们进行了初步研究。
A: ♣近  developmental, experimental, model, test, trial
A: ♣反  eventual, final, ultimate 最终的
A: ♠考法3  vt. 带领通过： lead or conduct over a usually difficult course
A: ♣例  The lobbyists piloted the bill through the Senate. 游说集团使法案得到参议院的批准。
A: ♣近  conduct, direct, guide, lead, route, show, steer
A: ♣反  follow 跟随

Q:pine  [pain]

A: ♣例  pine for a lost love 渴望那段逝去的爱情
A: ♣近  ache, crave, dream, hunger, itch, long, lust, repine, thirst, yearn
A: ♣反  abhor, detest, loathe 厌恶，反感
A: ♠考法2  vi. 因渴望而憔悴： to lose vigor, health, or flesh (as through grief)
A: ♣例  Separated by their families, the lovers pined away. 这对恋人因为被家人拆散而日益憔悴。
A: ♣近  decline, dwindle, fade, flag, languish, waste

Q:pinpoint  ['pinpɔint]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 非常精确的： located, fixed, or directed with extreme precision
A: ♣例  The commander demanded the pinpoint location of artillery fire. 指挥官需要火炮攻击的精确位置。
A: ♣近  accurate, close, delicate, exact, fine, hairline, mathematical, precise, refined, rigorous
A: ♣反  coarse, cursory, rough 粗略的；imprecise, inaccurate, inexact 不准确的
A: ♠考法2  v. 精确定位或确认： to locate, fix, determine, or identify with precision
A: ♣例  pinpoint the target by tracking calls from his cellphone 通过跟踪手机信号精确定位了目标‖pinpoint the cause of failure 准确找出失败的原因
A: ♣近  determine, distinguish, locate, identify, recognize, spot
A: ♣反  estimate 估计

Q:pioneer  [,paiə'niə]
A: ♠考法1  n. 扩荒者，先驱者： one of the first to settle in a territory
A: ♣例  the hardships that the pioneers endured while taming the wilderness 在驯服自然的过程中扩荒者所受到的种种磨难‖a pioneer in aviation 航空业的先驱
A: ♣近  colonist, colonizer, homesteader, settler
A: ♣反  follower 跟随者
A: ♠考法2  adj. 最初的，最早的： coming before all others in time or order
A: ♣例  the nation's pioneer institutions for the education of African-Americans 为了非裔美国人的教育而设立的第一批教育机构
A: ♣近  earliest, foremost, headmost, inaugural, initial, leadoff, maiden, original, premier, virgin
A: ♣反  final, last, latest, terminal, terminating, ultimate 最后的，终结的
A: ♠考法3  vt. 开创，创造： to open up (an area) or prepare (a way)
A: ♣例  He single-handedly pioneered the university’s institute for medical research. 他单枪匹马创建了这所大学里的医学研究所。‖rockets that pioneered outer space 开创了外太空纪元的火箭
A: ♣近  begin, constitute, establish, inaugurate, initiate, innovate, institute, introduce, launch, plant, set up
A: ♣反  close, end, shut,terminate, phase out 终止，淘汰
A: ♣派  pioneering adj. 先驱性的，先导性的

Q:pious  ['paiəs]
A: ♠考法1  adj. （信仰上）虔诚的： marked by or showing reverence for deity and devotion to divine worship
A: ♣例  a pious woman who decided to become a nun 一个决心成为修女的虔诚女子
A: ♣近  devout, godly, religious, sainted, saintly
A: ♣反  antireligious, faithless, godless, impious, irreligious, ungodly, unholy 不虔诚的，无宗教信仰的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 忠诚的： firm in one's allegiance to someone or something
A: ♣例  a pious supporter of his school's athletic teams, during winning and losing seasons alike 学校体育队的忠诚支持者，不论他们是输或赢
A: ♣近  constant, dedicated, devoted, loyal, staunch, steadfast, steady, true
A: ♣反  disloyal, fickle, inconstant, perfidious, recreant, traitorous, treacherous, unfaithful 不忠诚的，善变的

Q:piquant  ['pi:kənt]

A: ♣反  insipid, vapid, zestless 索然无味的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 令人振奋的： appealingly provocative
A: ♣例  a piquant glance 充满挑逗的一瞥
A: ♣近  exciting, pungent, racy, stimulating
A: ♣反  flat, pallid 单调的，无聊的

Q:pique  [pi:k]
A: ♠考法1  vt. 使愤怒： to arouse anger or resentment in

A: ♣近  aggravate, annoy, exasperate, infuriate, irritate, peeve, provoke, rile, roil, ruffle, vex
A: ♣反  delight, gratify, rejoice 使高兴
A: ♠考法2  vt. 激起，刺激： to excite or arouse especially by a provocation, challenge, or rebuff
A: ♣例  radical remarks that pique their curiosity 引起他们兴趣的激进评论
A: ♣近  arouse, encourage, excite, fire, impassion, incite, instigate, move, stimulate, stir
A: ♣反  allay, alleviate, assuage, ease, mitigate, mollify, palliate, relieve, soothe 平息，缓和

Q:pirate  ['paiərit]

A: ♣近  corsair, freebooter, rover

Q:pitfall  ['pitfɔ:l]
A: ♠考法1  n. 陷阱： a pit flimsily covered or camouflaged and used to capture and hold animals or men
A: ♣例  caught in a pitfall 掉下了陷阱‖Renting a house can be full of pitfalls for the unwary. 对于那些不注意的人来说租房也是危机四伏的。
A: ♣近  catch, gimmick, gotcha, hitch, joker, snag, snare, trap
A: ♠考法2  n. （不易察觉的）危害： a hidden or not easily recognized danger or difficulty
A: ♣例  One of the pitfalls of ignorance is that people will also assume you are stupid. 无知的一个危害就是，人们总会假设你一无所知。
A: ♣近  hazard, imminence, menace, peril, risk, threat, trouble

Q:pithy  ['piθi]

A: ♣反  circuitous, circumlocutory, diffuse, rambling, prolix, verbose, windy, wordy 冗长累赘的
A: ♣派  pithiness n. 简洁，犀利

A: ♣派  placation n. 安抚

Q:placebo  [plə'si:bəu]

A: ♣例  Candies are often adopted as the placebo for the dying patients. 糖果通常作为安慰剂给重症患者服用。

Q:placid  ['plæsid]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 宁静的，风平浪静的： free from storms or physical disturbance
A: ♣例  a vacation in the placid lake community 在宁静的湖区度过的假日
A: ♣近  calm, halcyon, hushed, peaceful, quiet, serene, still, stilly, tranquil, untroubled
A: ♣反  boisterous, clamorous, noisy, raucous, roistering, rowdy, tumultuous, uproarious 喧闹的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 冷静的，淡定的： free from emotional or mental agitation
A: ♣例  I know an exceptionally placid mother who was rarely upset by her six children 我认识一个异常淡定的母亲，她几乎从未因为自己的六个孩子而烦恼过。
A: ♣近  collected, composed, coolheaded, level, limpid, possessed, recollected, sedate, undisturbed, unperturbed
A: ♣反  agitated, discomposed, disturbed, flustered, perturbed, upset 不安的，焦虑的
A: ♣派  placidity n.宁静，安宁

Q:plagiarize  ['pleidʒjəraiz]

A: ♣例  In scientific community, plagiarizing other’s paper is a felony. 在学术界，剽窃他人的论文是一项重罪。
A: ♣近  steal
A: ♣派  plagiarism n. 剽窃

Q:plangent  ['plændʒənt]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 轰鸣的： having a loud reverberating sound
A: ♣例  The camera man was stunned by the plangent roar of wild animals. 摄影师被野生动物发出的怒号吓得不知所措。
A: ♣近  blaring, blasting, clamorous, deafening, earsplitting, resonant, resounding, sonorous, thunderous, vibrant
A: ♣反  muffled, muted 声音被减弱的；gentle, low, soft 声音轻柔的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 凄凉的，哀伤的： having an expressive and especially plaintive quality
A: ♣例  a plangent song about a long-ago love 一首关于往日爱情的凄凉歌曲
A: ♣近  doleful, dolorous, funeral, grieving, lamentable, lugubrious, plaintive, rueful, sorrowful, woeful
A: ♣反  agreeable, cheerful, delightful, enjoyable, jolly, pleasing 令人愉快的

Q:plastic  ['plæstik]

A: ♣例  the plastic quality of modeling clay 模型泥的可塑性质
A: ♣近  adaptable, ductile, flexible, malleable, pliable, pliant, resilient, supple
A: ♣反  inflexible, rigid, stiff 僵硬的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 虚假的，做作的： lacking in natural or spontaneous quality
A: ♣例  There's usually a plastic cordiality at these corporate events. 通常在公司的活动上都有一种虚假的热情和友好。
A: ♣近  affected, assumed, bogus, factitious, fake, false, feigned, mock, phony, pretended, pseudo, spurious
A: ♣反  artless, genuine, natural, spontaneous, unaffected, uncontrived, unfeigned 真诚的
A: ♣派  plasticity n. 可塑性

Q:plateau  ['plætəu]

A: ♣例  Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau 青藏高原
A: ♣近  highland, mesa, tableland, upland
A: ♣反  lowland 低谷；basin 盆地
A: ♠考法2  n. 稳定时期，平台期： a relatively stable level, period, or state
A: ♣例  reached a plateau of development 达到了发展的稳定期
A: ♣近  equilibrium, stage, stasis

Q:platitude  ['plætitju:d]

A: ♣例  the platitude of most political oratory 政治说辞里的陈词滥调

A: ♠考法2  n. 缺乏原创性： lack of originality
A: ♣近  triteness, staleness
A: ♣反  novelty 新颖性；originality 原创新

Q:plausible  ['plɔ:zəble]

A: ♣例  a plausible argument 看起来头头是道的说理
A: ♣近  believable, credible, likely, possible, presumable, probable 可信的
A: ♣反  paradoxical 看似矛盾的；implausible, improbable, incredible, unbelievable, unlikely 不太可能的
A: ♣派  plausibility n. 看似有理

Q:playful  ['pleiful]

A: ♣反  flatten, smooth 抹平

Q:plebeian  [pli'bi:jən]

Q:plenitude  ['plenitju:d]
A: ♠考法1  n. 丰富，充沛： an amount or supply more than sufficient to meet one's needs
A: ♣例  a region blessed with a plenitude of natural resources 充满着上帝赐予的丰富资源的地区
A: ♣近  abundance, cornucopia, feast, plentitude, plethora, wealth
A: ♣反  deficiency, inadequacy, insufficiency, undersupply 匮乏，不足
A: ♠考法2  n. 大量： a considerable amount
A: ♣例  She has gathered a plenitude of information on the topic. 有关这个话题她收集了大量的资料。
A: ♣近  bunch, bundle, dozen, multiplicity, myriad, plateful, plenty, profusion, reams, scads, spate, stack, volume
A: ♣反  ace, bit, glimmer, handful, hint, mite, nip, ounce, pittance, speck, spot, trace 少量

Q:plentitude  ['plentitju:d]

A: ♣例  a plentitude of lumber for the current housing market 充足的家具木材供给
A: ♣近  abundance, affluence, cornucopia, myriad, plenty, profusion, stack, wealth
A: ♣反  dearth, deficiency, inadequacy, insufficiency 缺乏，匮乏；mite, peanuts, pinch, pittance, trace 少量

Q:plethora  ['pleθərə]

A: ♣例  a plethora of advice and a paucity of assistance 给出大量建议而鲜有实质性援助
A: ♣近  abundance, cornucopia, feast, overabundance, overflow, plentitude, profusion, surfeit, surplus
A: ♣反  dearth, inadequacy, insufficiency, paucity, scarcity, undersupply 缺乏
A: ♣派  plethoric adj. 过量的

Q:pliable  ['plaiəbl]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 易弯曲的，柔软的： supple enough to bend freely or repeatedly without breaking
A: ♣例  pliable optical fiber 柔软的光纤
A: ♣近  adaptable, ductile, flexible, limber, plastic, supple
A: ♣反  inflexible, rigid, stiff 不易弯曲的；unbending 难弯曲的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 易受影响的，温顺的： easily influenced, persuaded, or swayed
A: ♣例  He took advantage of the pliable mind of youth. 他利用了年轻人容易受他人教唆的特点。
A: ♣近  compliant, docile, obedient, pliant, tractable, subdued
A: ♣反  contumacious, insubordinate, intractable, obstreperous, recalcitrant, refractory, unruly 难控制的

Q:pliant  ['plaiənt]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 易弯曲的： easily bent or flexed
A: ♣例  a pliant young tree 易弯曲的小树
A: ♣近  adaptable, ductile, flexible, limber, plastic, supple
A: ♣反  inflexible, rigid, stiff 不易弯曲的；unbending 难弯曲的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 顺从的： yielding readily to influence or domination
A: ♣例  She’s proud and stubborn, you know, under that pliant exterior. 你知道在温顺的外表下，她骄傲而固执。
A: ♣近  compliant, docile, obedient, pliant, tractable, subdued
A: ♣反  contumacious, insubordinate, intractable, obstreperous, recalcitrant, refractory, unruly 难控制的

Q:plight  [plait]
A: ♠考法1  n. 困境： a situation, especially a bad or unfortunate one
A: ♣例  He was in a plight, trying to decide whether or not to take the job. 他处在不知道是否应该接受这份工作的困境之中。
A: ♣近  dilemma, jam, predicament, quandary

Q:plod  [plɔd]
A: ♠考法1  v. 沉重缓慢地走： to walk heavily or slowly
A: ♣例  The soldiers slowly plodded across the marsh. 士兵们慢慢走过沼泽地。
A: ♣近  tramp, trudge
A: ♣反  flit 迅速飞过；gambol 雀跃
A: ♣派  plodding adj. 走路沉重缓慢的

Q:plodder  ['plɔdə]
A: ♠考法1  n. 行走缓慢的人： someone who moves slowly or more slowly than others
A: ♣例  The guide halted the tour group so that the plodders who had fallen behind could catch up. 导游让队伍停下来，以便那些落在后头的行动缓慢的人可以跟上。
A: ♣近  crawler, dallier, dawdler, dragger, laggard, lagger, lingerer, loiterer, snail, straggler
A: ♣反  speedster 速度快的人

Q:pluck  [plʌk]
A: ♠考法1  n. 敢于面对困难的勇气： resourceful courage and daring in the face of difficulties
A: ♣例  full of pluck 充满了勇气
A: ♣近  backbone, courage, dauntlessness, grit, guts, resolution, spirit, spunk
A: ♣反  cowardice, coward, spinelessness 胆小，怯懦
A: ♠考法2  v. 弹奏（弦乐）： to sound (the strings of an instrument) by pulling and releasing them with the fingers or a plectrum
A: ♣例  pluck the harp 弹奏竖琴
A: ♣近  play
A: ♣派  plucky adj. 勇敢的

Q:plumb  [plʌm]
A: ♠考法1  vt. 测深度： to measure the depth of (as a body of water) typically with a weighted line
A: ♣例  We will plumb the bay to make sure it was deep enough for the huge vessel. 为了确证水深足够容纳这艘巨轮，我们将会测量海湾的深度。‖questions that plumb the depths of stupidity 测量智商下限的问题
A: ♣近  fathom
A: ♠考法2  adj. 垂直的： exactly vertical
A: ♣近  perpendicular, upright, vertical
A: ♣反  horizontal 水平的
A: ♠考法3  adj. 完全的，绝对的： having no exceptions or restrictions
A: ♣派  Such a movie is plumb trash and further evidence of the deterioration of popular culture. 这样的电影就是彻头彻尾的垃圾，它进一步证明了大众文化的堕落和腐化。
A: ♣近  absolute, categorical, complete, consummate, definite, pure, sheer, thorough, utter, very
A: ♣反  doubtful, dubious, equivocal, questionable, uncertain 不确定的；qualified 有条件的
A: ♠考法4  v. 仔细深入地检查： to examine closely or deeply
A: ♣例  plumbing the book's complexities 审阅这本书的复杂度
A: ♣近  explore, delve, inquire, investigate, probe

Q:plummet  ['plʌmit]
A: ♠考法1  v. 突然下降： to decline suddenly and steeply
A: ♣例  Overall GPA plummeted 0.5 points. 平均学分绩骤降0.5。
A: ♣近  crash, decline, descend, dip, dive, fall, plunge, sink, tumble
A: ♣反  skyrocket, soar 飙升

Q:plump  [plʌmp]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 丰满的： well-rounded and full in form
A: ♣例  In Tang Dynasty, being plump was a sign of ultimate beauty. 在唐代，身材丰满是最美丽的象征。
A: ♣近  chubby, fleshy, fat, gross, obese, rotund, round
A: ♣反  lean, slender, svelte, thin 纤瘦的，苗条的；angular 因消瘦而棱角分明的
A: ♠考法2  vi. 鼎力支持，赞口不绝： to give full support or praise
A: ♣例  We will plump for any candidate who supports stem cell research. 我们会鼎力支持那些拥护干细胞研究的候选人。
A: ♣近  advocate, back, champion, endorse, patronize
A: ♣反  baffle, foil, frustrate, sabotage 阻挠，从中破坏

Q:plunge  [plʌndʒ]
A: ♠考法1  vi. 突然下降： to descend or dip suddenly
A: ♣例  stock’s value plunged 股票价值骤然下降
A: ♣近  crash, decline, descend, dip, dive, fall, plummet, plunge, sink, tumble
A: ♣反  skyrocket, soar 飙升
A: ♠考法2  vt. 插入，刺入： to cause to penetrate or enter quickly and forcibly into something
A: ♣例  plunged the dagger into his chest 把匕首刺入他的胸膛
A: ♣近  drive, stab, stick, thrust
A: ♣反  extract 拔出

Q:plush  [plʌʃ]
A: ♠考法1  adj. （味道等）浓郁的： having an abundance of some characteristic quality (as flavor)
A: ♣例  a plush, ripe wine 味道浓郁的陈年老窖
A: ♣近  concentrated, full, heady, lusty, muscular, potent, rich, robust, strong
A: ♣反  delicate, light, mild, thin, weak （味道等）淡的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 奢华的，豪华的： notably luxurious
A: ♣例  a plush castle filled with priceless art and antiques 一座充满了无价艺术品和古董的奢华城堡
A: ♣近  deluxe, lavish, luxuriant, luxurious, opulent, palatial, silken, sumptuous
A: ♣反  ascetic, austere, humble, spartan 朴素的，平凡的

Q:poach  [pəutʃ]

A: ♣例  He poached an egg for breakfast. 他煮了一个荷包蛋做早饭。
A: ♣近  coddle, parboil, simmer, stew

Q:pointer  ['pɔintə]
A: ♠考法1  n. （仪表上的）指针： a scale indicator on a watch, balance, or other measuring instrument
A: ♣例  The pointer on my bathroom scale must be stuck - I know I lost weight. 浴室磅秤里的指针肯定坏了——我知道我体重有下降的。
A: ♣近  hand, index, indicator, needle
A: ♠考法2  n. 忠告，建议： a useful suggestion or hintusually from an expert
A: ♣例  Here are a few pointers to help you make a choice. 这里有一些能帮助你抉择的建议。
A: ♣近  advice, hint, lead, recommendation, tip

Q:polarize  ['pəuləraiz]

Q:polemic  [pɔ'lemik]

A: ♣近  contention, controversy, disagreement, disputation
A: ♣反  agreement 一致，协议
A: ♣派  polemical adj. 好争论的

Q:polished  ['pɔliʃt]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 有教养的： showing a high degree of refinement and the assurance that comes from wide social experience
A: ♣例  He maintained a very polished tone in his correspondences. 他在通信中保持着一种极有教养的口吻。
A: ♣近  cultivated, cultured, genteel, refined, urbane
A: ♣反  gauche, rustic, philistine 粗俗的；uncivilized, untutored 未开化的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 擦亮的： having a shiny surface or finish
A: ♣例  She could see her face reflected in the polished hood of the car. 她可以通过引擎盖光亮的表面看到自己的脸。
A: ♣近  buffed, burnished, glistening, lustrous, rubbed, satiny, sleek
A: ♣反  dim, dull, flat, lusterless 黯淡无光的
A: ♣派  polish v. 擦亮

Q:politic  ['pɔlitik]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 精明能干的： characterized by shrewdness in managing, contriving, or dealing
A: ♣例  a politic secretary 能干的秘书
A: ♣近  diplomatic, judicious, perspicacious, sagacious, tactful, wise
A: ♣反  tactless, unsophisticated 缺乏谋略的，头脑简单的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 合时宜的，明智的： suitable for bringing about a desired result under the circumstances
A: ♣例  It probably would not be politic to tell your boss that his latest idea is the worst thing you've ever heard. 不要现在去告诉你老板说他的想法是你听过的最糟的，这不是一个合时宜的做法。
A: ♣近  advisable, desirable, prudent, tactical
A: ♣反  imprudent, inadvisable, injudicious, unwise 不明智的，不合时宜的

Q:pompous  ['pɔmpəs]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 浮夸的： excessively elevated or ornate
A: ♣例  The candidate was given to windy rhetorical speeches. 听众们听了一场冗长而浮夸的演讲。
A: ♣近  affected, bombastic, flowery, grandiloquent, magniloquent, rhetorical, sonorous
A: ♣反  homely 朴素的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 傲慢的： having or exhibiting self-importance
A: ♣例  a pompous politician who insisted on boarding the plane first 一个坚持要求优先登机的傲慢政客
A: ♣近  arrogant, egocentric, haughty, pontifical, presumptuous, supercilious
A: ♣反  humble, modest, unpretentious 谦逊的

Q:ponderable  ['pɔndərəbl]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 有价值的，值得考虑的： considerable enough to be weighed or assessed
A: ♣例  Climate change has exerted a ponderable influence on world politics. 气候变化对世界政局有着不容忽视的影响。
A: ♣近  appreciable, perceptible, sensible
A: ♣反  inappreciable 微不足道的

Q:ponderous  ['pɔndərəs]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 沉重的： of very great weight
A: ♣例  a ponderous machine 沉重的机器
A: ♣近  cumbersome, heavy, hefty, massive, onerous, weighty
A: ♣反  ethereal, gossamer, light, weightless 轻飘飘的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 沉闷无聊的： oppressively or unpleasantly dull
A: ♣例  a ponderous sermon no one really cares 实际上无人关心的沉闷无聊的布道
A: ♣近  dreary, dull, flat, elephantine, monotonous, insipid, vapid
A: ♣反  absorbing, engaging, engrossing, gripping, interesting, intriguing, involving, riveting 极吸引人的

Q:pontificate  [pɔn'tifikit]

A: ♣例  pontificate to show a sense of superiority 傲慢地说以显示高人一等的优越感
A: ♣反  condescend 屈尊，俯就
A: ♣派  pontification n. 傲慢的言行；pontifical adj. 傲慢的

Q:pore  [pɔ:]
A: ♠考法1  vi. 仔细浏览，仔细研究： to read or study attentively(usually used with over)
A: ♣例  The committee will probably pore over the results of the study for a long time before making their decision. 在正式做决定之前，委员会或需要花很长的时间来仔细研究调查结果。
A: ♣近  cogitate, consider, contemplate, deliberate, meditate, perpend, ruminate, study, weigh, chew over
A: ♣反  flip, glance, leaf, riffle, skim 粗略地看，迅速浏览

Q:porous  ['pɔ:rəs]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 多孔可渗透的： admitting the passage of gas or liquid through pores or interstices
A: ♣例  Lava rock has a porous structure which makes the material lightweight and highly moisture-retentive. 火山岩的多孔结构使得它密度很小，同时有很高的吸湿性。
A: ♣近  passable, penetrable, permeable, pervious
A: ♣反  impassable, impenetrable, impermeable, impervious 无法穿透的
A: ♣派  porosity n. 多孔性

Q:portentous  [pɔ:'tentəs]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 预兆性的，凶兆的： being or showing a sign of evil or calamity to come
A: ♣例  an eerie and portentous stillness 阴森神秘，充满凶兆的寂静
A: ♣近  baleful, direful, doomy, foreboding, inauspicious, menacing, minatory, ominous, sinister, ill-omened
A: ♣反  auspicious, propitious 吉兆的
A: ♠考法2  adj. 勾起兴趣的，令人遐想的：eliciting amazement or wonder
A: ♣例  The way in which he could bring together opposing forces was truly portentous. 他整合两股对抗势力的方法着实令人好奇
A: ♣近  amazing, astonishing, astounding, fabulous, marvelous, miraculous, prodigious, wonderful
A: ♣反  common, commonplace, ordinary 普通的

Q:poseur  [pəu'zə:]
A: ♠考法1  n. 故作姿态、不真诚的人：an affected or insincere person
A: ♣例  She is such a poseur and you will never know if she is really crying or pretending. 她就是个爱装的人，你从不知道她是真的在哭还是只是假装而已。
A: ♣近  grandstander, poser

Q:posit  ['pɔzit]
A: ♠考法1  vt.假定，断定：to assume or affirm the existence of
A: ♣例  The committee posited that he was qualified for the election. 委员会假定他是够格参加选举的。
A: ♣近  assume, postulate, presuppose, premise, presume
A: ♣反  falsify 证明为假

Q:postulate  ['pɔstjuleit]
A: ♠考法1  n. 前提条件： something taken as being true or factual and used as a starting point for a course of action or reasoning
A: ♣例  One of the postulates that the true agnostic rejects is the assumption that it is even possible for us to know whether God exists. 我们无法知道上帝是否存在——这是一个真正的不可知论者所反对的假设。
A: ♣近  premise, presumption, presupposition, supposition
A: ♣反  conclusion 结论
A: ♠考法2  v. 假定为真： to assume or claim as true, existent, or necessary
A: ♣例  postulate a causal relationship 假定存在因果关系
A: ♣近  assume, conjecture, hypothesize, posit, presuppose, premise, presume, suppose
A: ♣反  belie, disprove, falsify 证明为假
A: ♣派  postulation n. 推测

Q:posture  ['pɔstʃə]
A: ♠考法1  n. 姿势，姿态： a general way of holding the body
A: ♣例  A good upright posture will prevent backaches. 良好的站姿可以预防背痛。
A: ♣近  attitude, carriage, poise, stance, station
A: ♠考法2  vi. 故作姿态，装模作样： to assume an artificial or pretended attitude
A: ♣例  postured to impress 故作姿态以给别人留下印象
A: ♣近  attitudinize, feign, grandstand, masquerade, pose, pretend
A: ♣派  posturer n. 故作姿态之人

Q:potable  ['pəutəbl]

A: ♣例  Potables are offered at bar counter for free. 饮料可以在吧台免费领取。

A: ♣近  drinkable, edible
A: ♣反  undrinkable 不能饮用的

Q:potentate  ['pəutənteit]

Q:potentiate  [pəu'tenʃieit]

A: ♣例  additives to potentiate the drug 增强药效的添加剂
A: ♣近  activate, energize, enhance, intensify, stir, wake, vitalize
A: ♣反  deactivate 使无效；abate, attenuate, dwindle, lessen, moderate, reduce 减弱，削弱

Q:pout  [paut]

A: ♣例  She pouted and didn't say a word to anyone all morning. 她整个早上都闷闷不乐，没和别人说一句话。
A: ♣近  grump, mope, sulk
A: ♣反  grin 露齿而笑

Q:practitioner  [præk'tiʃənə]

A: ♣例  medical practitioner 医护人员，行医者
A: ♣近  expert, expounder, guru, professional, specialist, virtuoso
A: ♣反  fledgling 无经验的人；quack 冒充内行的人

Q:pragmatic  [præɡ'mætik]
A: ♠考法1  adj. 实用主义的，务实的： a practical approach to problems and affairs
A: ♣例  Pragmatic men of power have had no time or inclination to deal withsocial morality.(K. B. Clark) 务实的当权者不会有时间或者意向去处理社会道德的问题。——K. B. 克拉克‖a pragmatic man, not given to grand, visionary schemes 一个不迷恋花哨空想的计划，而更注重实际的人
A: ♣近  down-to-earth, earthy, hardheaded, matter-of-fact, practical
A: ♣反  fanciful, idealistic, impractical, unrealistic, utopian, visionary 幻想的，不务实的
A: ♣派  pragmatism n. 实用主义，务实主义

Q:prairie  ['prεəri]
